business.headline: Why are markets volatile, and should you be worried? 3 things to know Sensex scaled to 76,985.95, reaching the day's high, a jump of over 500 points, but was trading at 76,621.03 as of 1 PM. Nifty has also gone about in the same manner.

Paytm denies ED probe in crypto scam, calls reports 'factually incorrect'Paytm Latest News: Paytm's clarification came after a few media reports claimed that the ED is investigating the fintech firm and other payment gateways in a cryptocurrency scam.

Explained: Why Paytm share price tumbled nearly 9% todayPaytm share price: The shares of the company fell nearly 9% to hit a day's low of Rs 773.90. At 12:18 pm, shares of the fintech company stabilised a bit to trade 2.27% higher at Rs 829.70.
Why did Cyient CEO Karthikeyan Natarajan resign?The resignation of Cyient's CEO Karthikeyan Natarajan was a major reason that led to the sharp decline in the company's share price.

HUL to acquire stake in Minimalist for Rs 2,670 crore; Peak XV bags 10X gainsHUL has acquired a 90.5% stake in Minimalist for Rs 2,670 crore, making it one of the biggest acquisitions in the country's startup ecosystem.

Cyient share price falls 20% to hit 52-week low. What triggered Friday's crash?Cyient stock price: At around 10:21 am, shares of Cyient were down 17.96% to Rs 1,438 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). In early trade, shares of the IT company fell as much as 20% to hit a 52-week low of Rs 1,402.25.

Explained: Why Dr Reddy's share price cracked 6% in early tradeDr Reddy's Laboratories Stock Price: Dr Reddy's shares tumbled up to 6% in early trade and at 9:46 am, they were trading 4.35% lower at Rs 1,233.25 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

Sensex, Nifty open higher tracking Asian markets; energy stocks gainShare Market Today, 24 January 2025: The S&P BSE Sensex was up 204.76 points to 76,725.14 at 9:17 am, while the NSE Nify50 traded 64.15 points higher at 23,269.50.

Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw says manufacturing, services, AI to drive growthAt the World Economic Forum, Minister Ashwini Vaishnav outlined India's economic strategy based on four pillars: public investment in infrastructure, focus on manufacturing and innovation, inclusive growth, and simplification of laws.

EPFO simplifies personal profile updation process. Check steps hereEPF members can update their personal details like name, gender, date of birth, nationality and marital status without the need to submit any documents.

Budget 2025: Startups seeks extended tax holidays, access to affordable creditSeveral experts have shared their Budget 2025 expectations for the startup sector, seeking reforms to help this sector maintain its growth momentum and scale globally.
Sensex, Nifty gain ground as IT, pharma sectors shine; Wipro gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex gained 115.39 points to close at 76,520.38, while the NSE Nifty50 added 50 points to end at 23,205.35.

Reliance signs Rs 3 lakh crore pact with Maharashtra; to create lakhs of jobsReliance signs pact with Maharashtra: The pact spans across different sectors, with Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis calling it a landmark investment, poised to boost Maharashtra's growth.

Our economy is growing, there's space for everyone: Aryaman BirlaAryaman Vikram Birla, Director of Aditya Birla Management Corporation said that the economy and the country is growing rapidly and there is space for everyone to do well.

Is Donald Trump bluffing about his tariff threats?Donald Trump has been vocal about imposing 10% tariffs on imports from China, 25% on neighbouring Mexico and Canada, and the European Union (EU). He has even threatened to impose a 100% tariff on BRICS nations, including India.

Aryaman Birla bullish on Aditya Birla Group: Very well-placedWorld Economic Forum, Davos: Aryaman Vikram Birla said that the economy of the country is growing and there's an opportunity for everyone to be a part of it.

Perplexity AI CEO calls Nandan Nilekani 'awesome' but his AI stance 'wrong' Aravind Srinivas called Nandan Nilekani "awesome" for his contributions to India's IT sector, but disagreed with the Infosys co-founder's stance on AI development.
Explained: Why HUL share price fell in early trade today HUL Stock price fell over 3% in early trade as investors reacted negatively to its Q3 results despite a 19% rise in net profit.

Stallion India share price: Stock lists at 33% premium over IPO price Stallion India shares opened at Rs 120 on both the National Stock Exchange (NSE) and the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), translating to a premium of 33%.

BB 18 winner Karan Veer Mehra's ex-wife, actor Nidhi Seth gets marriedTwo years after separating from Karanveer Mehra, actress Nidhi Seth remarried her boyfriend Sandiip Kummar. Recently, she shared pictures from her temple wedding.

Watch: BTS' J-hope, Rose, G-Dragon and Taeyang claim the stage at Paris eventBTS member J-hope, Blackpink's Rose, and G-Dragon and Taeyang of BigBang recently marked their presence at a Paris event. J-hope even shared photos from his performance on social media.

When Life Gives You Tangerines: Park Bo-gum, IU's K-drama to premiere on this dateThe much-anticipated K-drama, When Life Gives You Tangerines, starring Park Bo-gum and IU, will premiere on Netflix on March 7. The streaming date was shared alongside the show's first teaser.

Instead, the Ashwni Dhir directorial falls into the usual traps of the everyman story. Read our take on the film here.

Paatal Lok 2 ending explained: What's next for Hathi Ram, did he get Rs 2 crore?Paatal Lok 2 continues to captivate audiences with its intricate storyline and profound depiction of Nagaland's socio-political landscape. The series resolves its many mysteries, leaving viewers pondering Inspector Hathi Ram's future. Find out what the season's ending meant and whether there will be a third season of Paatal Lok.

Pics: Rapper Emiway Bantai marries singer-actor SwaalinaRapper Eminem Batai surprised fans as he shared photos from his intimate wedding ceremony with actor and singer Swaalina. The duo worked together in the 2023 music video, Kudi.

Ian Bohen on working with Salman Khan in Marigold, Yellowstone, Teen Wolf, Hollywood dreams Ian Bohen opened up in an exclusive chat about the emotional and dramatic finale season of Yellowstone and credited Teen Wolf for bolstering his self-assurance. He also spoke about Salman Khan, whom he co-starred in Marigold.

Wolf Man Cast Interview: Julia Garner says 'India Hire Me'; Leigh Whannell on directing Bollywood film In an exclusive chat with India Today's Bhavna Agarwal, Julia and Leigh spoke about Wolf Man and their experience working on it and interest in Bollywood.

Meet Shashi Kapoor's grandson Zahan Kapoor: Unlike any Kapoor and Sons | Black WarrantZahan Kapoor, grandson of Bollywood icon Shashi Kapoor, is earning praise for his role in the crime thriller Black Warrant. In an exclusive interview with India Today, Zahan expressed gratitude for the overwhelming response and Kapoor legacy.

Watch: Actor Rozlyn Khan accuses Hina Khan of using cancer for publicityRozlyn Khan, a breast cancer survivor, has raised questions about Hina Khan's actions post-mastectomy, suggesting the actor might be using her cancer diagnosis for publicity.
Singer Antara slams Jasleen Royal's Coldplay act: Put music on topSinger Antara Mitra called out Jasleen Royal's opening act with Coldplay. She requested people to 'put music on top'.

Jaideep Ahlawat 'melted like makhan' after Amul's 'Lok-priya snack' honourActor Jaideep Ahlawat shared a gratitude note on social media after Amul gave a shout-out to his character from his latest release, Paatal Lok Season 2. The actor plays the role of Hathi Ram Chaudhary.
The Family Man 3 wrap-up party: Manoj Bajpayee, Samantha pose for picsThe cast of The Family Man 3 has wrapped up shoot for the show. Makers Raj and DK shared photos from their wrap-up party.

Is Friends star David Schwimmer dating a student-activist? Here's the truthDavid Schwimmer, famed for his role in Friends, is in the limelight after being seen with medical student, Eliana Jolkovsky. The duo's outing in Beverly Hills has sparked rumours about their relationship.

TV actor Gurucharan Singh's father shares his health update: He's out of dangerTaarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah actor Gurucharan Singh who was earlier hospitalised, is currently okay. His father shared his health update and said that the actor is out of danger now.

Ed Sheeran seeks recommendations for restaurants in IndiaEd Sheeran is all set to return to his favourite places on Earth -- India. Sharing a post on Instagram, he expressed his excitement for the upcoming "+ - = · x Tour".

TV show CID to air Rishab Shetty's Kantara-inspired episode. DetailsThe popular TV show CID will air an episode dedicated to Rishab Shetty's Kantara. Ahead of that, pictures were released that feature Dayanand Shetty, aka Daya, in a similar appearance.

Boman Irani's directorial debut The Mehta Boys to release on this dateThe Mehta Boys OTT release date: Boman Irani and Avinash Tiwary's The Mehta Boys is set for its OTT premiere. The critically-acclaimed film will release on Prime Video in February.

general news.headline: Massive blast at ordnance factory in Maharashtra's Bhandara, 6 criticalAs a result of the blast, a roof collapsed with 12 people stuck inside. While two have been rescued, ten people are still stuck inside, according to district officials.

10 opposition MPs suspended after uproar at Waqf board parliamentary panel meetTen opposition MPs, including Asaduddin Owaisi and Kalyan Banerjee, were suspended for a day amid uproar during the JPC meeting on the Waqf Amendment Bill 2024. Trinamool Congress's Banerjee criticised the chairman's authoritarian conduct.

Fearing family reprisal, Mumbai woman inserts blade in private parts after rapePolice said the 20-year-old woman inserted a surgical blade and stones into her private parts after being raped by an autorickshaw driver in Mumbai.

No Indian in ICC Men's ODI Team of the Year, Asalanka named captainNo Indian is a part of the ICC Men's ODI Team of the Year 2024. Charith Asalanka was named the skipper of the team. Saim Ayub, Shaheen Shah Afridi and Haris Rauf have been picked.

What is A23a, world's largest iceberg set to collide with British island?Currently, 280 kilometres away, iceberg A23a is propelled by potent winds and ocean currents. A23a's mobility has long caught the attention of the scientific community.

Semi-finals, Live Updates: Jannik Sinner vs Ben Shelton up next Australian Open semi-finals, Live Updates: Novak Djokovic had to retire after just one set in his semi-final clash against Alexander Zverev due to an apparent injury problem, and the German goes through to what will be his third grand-slam final. Jannik Sinner vs Ben Shelton to follow at the Rod Laver Arena.

Sky Force review: Akshay Kumar in positive, non-fussy film about emotions, valourReleased-Fri Jan 24, 2025Sky Force movie review: It's always tempting for the makers to overdo India vs Pakistan in a war drama. However, in Sky Force, jingoism is muted and a sense of mutual respect for the soldiers exists. Starring Akshay Kumar and Veer Pahariya, the film looks decent.

Citizens of which country? US-born child of H-1B visa holders can be IndianA Donald Trump executive order, now temporarily blocked by a district court, denied US-born children of non-citizens birthright citizenship. Trump has vowed to challenge the court ban. So, what happens to the children born to Indians on temporary visas, like H-1B and L1, in the US if Trump has his way? Whose citizens are they?

Man takes parents to dinner at 5-star where father was a guard 25 years agoA man shared a heartwarming story about visiting ITC with his father who had worked at the luxury hotel as a watchman from 1995 to 2000.

Why South leans more towards science? Explaining the trendScience and other STEM branches (Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics) at school and in colleges have importance in South Indian education systems, from an early level. This article explores why South India leans more towards science.

Asaduddin Owaisi challenges Arvind Kejriwal: Walk on Okhla streets. You'll seeAIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi criticised AAP leader Arvind Kejriwal, likening him to Prime Minister Modi and accusing AAP of neglecting Okhla. Campaigning for AIMIM's candidate, Owaisi claimed AAP's defeat was imminent.

Saif Ali Khan recounts attack to cops: Was with Kareena, suddenly heard screamingIn his statement to police, Saif Ali Khan said he and his wife Kareena Kapoor were in their bedroom when they heard screams from their house help, Eliyama Phillip. Norovirus, bacteria found in Pune samples of Guillain-Barre Syndrome: ReportsGuillain-Barre Syndrome: Experts have found Norovirus and Campylobacter bacteria in some of the samples from those affected by Guillain-Barre Syndrome in Pune. This is a rare neurological disease.

US judge blocks Trump's birthright citizenship order: Blatantly unconstitutionalA US federal judge has temporarily blocked President Trump's executive order ending birthright citizenship, calling it "blatantly unconstitutional." Shardul desperate for India comeback: Give chances to those who have qualityShardul Thakur once again saved Mumbai's blushes in the Ranji Trophy. Shardul's rapid fifty helped Mumbai get past the total of 100 runs against Jammu and Kashmir on Thursday, January 23.

Jay Shah, Sourav Ganguly inducted in World Cricket Advisory BoardICC chairman Jay Shah and former India captain Sourav Ganguly have been inducted in the newly instituted World Cricket Connects Advisory Board. The board is expected to discuss the many challenges and opportunities in the sport during a discussion at the Lord's in June.

Twins vs sisters: Australian Open 2025 match breaks the internet Fans witnessed some twin magic in Melbourne on Thursday, January 23 during the junior girls doubles semi-final match between the Kovackovas and the Penickovas. The duos wore matching dresses while facing each other as the spectacle won the hearts of fans online.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.
